alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of East Central Maine, including the following county, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM EST, Howland Fire Department and Emergency Management reported a 2 to 3 mile long ice jam on the Penobscot River above the Howland Dam. This is causing flooding near Merrill Brook Lane and Gardner Lane in Howland cutting off access to residents. Water continues to rise on Gordon Brook near Mattamiscontis Road, leading to minor flooding near Mattamiscontis Road. Both Gardner Lane and Mattamiscontis Roads are closed due to flood waters. Water behind the ice jam will continue to slowly rise with runoff and upstream snow melt. - Residents near Merrill Brook that are located on Merrill Brook Lane and Gardner Lane, and along Mattamiscontis Road near Gordon Brook are the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Howland, Mattamiscontis Township, Enfield, and Chester. - Flood safety can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Water levels can rise and fall quickly in the vicinity of ice jams. Those with interests along rivers and tributary streams should be alert for rapidly fluctuating water levels in the vicinity of ice jams. Never drive through flooded roads or around closed road barricades. The barricades are there for your safety due to the potential for ice jam releases or continued flooding.
